what: The goal of OrgSeg package is to make the use of OrganoSeg analysis software easier.
title: The goal of OrgSeg package is to make the use of OrganoSeg analysis software easier.
text: goal OrgSeg package make use OrganoSeg analysis software easier. importing pre-processing raw excel file software running analysis plotting figures.

title: The goal of OrgSeg package is to make the use of OrganoSeg analysis software easier.
text: can install development version OrgSeg GitHub :

title: The goal of OrgSeg package is to make the use of OrganoSeg analysis software easier.
text: example running analysis. Read import OrganoSeg software output excel file following: Read experiment information .csv file extract treatments related indices list: Create merged tibble data 3 columns Area, Replicate, Treatment: Create summary table evaluate experiment controls: Based summary table, define breaks tags following: Create table inspect bins controls: Create plot inspect bins controls: Adjust brakes needed inspect table plot , happy can continue.
code: library(OrgSeg) # Load the package file_path = system.file("extdata", "test_data.xls", package = "OrgSeg") # Path to the OrganoSeg output excel file. Here we've provided an example data file included in the package that you can access the path with system.file("extdata", "test_data.xls", package = "OrgSeg"). data <- read_excel_file(file_path) exp_info_path = system.file("extdata", "exp_info.csv", package = "OrgSeg") # Path to the experiment information .csv file. Here we've provided an example experiment information .csv file included in the package that you can access the path with system.file("extdata", "test_data.xls", package = "OrgSeg"). exp_info_list <- read_exp_info(exp_info_path) all_data <- tibbleing_loop (data, exp_info_list$index_list, exp_info_list$treatments) ctrl_table(all_data) breaks <- c(0,427,848,1869,50000) # Min/NegCtrl 3rd Qu./DMSO Mean/PosCtrl 3rd Qu./Max tags <- c("noise","small organoids","medium organoids","large organoids") inspect_bins_table(all_data, breaks, tags) inspect_bins_plot(all_data, breaks, tags)
